### Read The Text
```{r echo=FALSE, message=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(fontawesome)
library(knitr)
library(kableExtra)
```

```{r eval = TRUE, echo = FALSE, message=FALSE}
read_schedule <- read_csv("readings.csv",
                          show_col_types = FALSE) %>% 
                  as_tibble() %>%
                  mutate(Required = case_when(
                  Required == "checked" ~ as.character(fontawesome::fa("check-circle", fill = "#428bca", height = "15px"))
              )) %>%
                  mutate(across(everything(), as.character)) %>%
                    filter(Week == 11) %>% #CHANGE HERE
                    select(-Week) %>%
                  filter_all(any_vars(!is.na(.))) %>% 
                  mutate(
                    across(everything(), ~replace_na(.x, ""))
                  ) %>%
                select_if(~!all(is.na(.))) 
  
```

```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, eval = TRUE, echo = FALSE}
kable(read_schedule, 
      escape = FALSE,
      align = 'lllccccccccc') %>%
  kable_paper(full_width = F) %>%
  column_spec(1, width = "15em") %>%
  column_spec(2, width = "20em") %>%
  column_spec(3, width = "7em") %>%
  column_spec(4, width = "10em") %>%
  column_spec(5, width = "10em") %>%
  column_spec(6, width = "5em") %>%
  column_spec(1:6, color = "#ffffff") %>%
  row_spec(0:2, extra_css = 'vertical-align: middle !important;', color = "#ffffff", background = "transparent")
```

### Read Papers

```{r echo=FALSE}
unchecked <- as.character(fontawesome::fa("square", fill = "#63d6c6"))

checked <- as.character(fontawesome::fa("check-square", fill = "#63d6c6"))

pdf_link1 <- function() {
 paste0("<a href='/handouts/Idler,%20Hudson,%20&%20Leventhal%20(1999).pdf' target='_blank'>", "<img src='/logos/pdf-ico.png' alt='Slack icon' width='40'>", "</a>")
}

pdf_link2 <- function() {
 paste0("<a href='/handouts/Morgan%20(2007).pdf' target='_blank'>", "<img src='/logos/pdf-ico.png' alt='Slack icon' width='40'>", "</a>")
}

pdf_link3 <- function() {
 paste0("<a href='/handouts/Way,%20Stauber,%20Nakkula,%20&%20London%20(1994).pdf' target='_blank'>", "<img src='/logos/pdf-ico.png' alt='Slack icon' width='40'>", "</a>")
}

readings <- tibble(
  
  paper <- c("Idler, E. L., Hudson, S. V., & Leventhal, H. (1999). The Meanings of Self-Ratings of Health: A Qualitative and Quantitative Approach. <i>Research on Aging, 21</i>(3), 458–476. <a href='https://doi.org/10.1177/2345678906292462' target='_blank'>https://doi.org/10.1177/2345678906292462</a>",
             
             "Morgan, D. L. (2007). Paradigms Lost and Pragmatism Regained: Methodological Implications of Combining Qualitative and Quantitative Methods. <i>Journal of Mixed Methods Research, 1</i>(1), 48–76. <a href='https://doi.org/10.1177/2345678906292462' target='_blank'>https://doi.org/10.1177/2345678906292462</a>",
             
           "Way, N., Stauber, H. Y., Nakkula, M. J., & London, P. (1994). Depression and substance use in two divergent high school cultures: A quantitative and qualitative analysis. <i>Journal of Youth and Adolescence, 23</i>(3), 331–357. <a href='https://doi.org/10.1177/2345678906292462' target='_blank'>https://doi.org/10.1007/BF01536723</a>"  
  ),
  
  download <- c(
    pdf_link1(),
    pdf_link2(),
    pdf_link3()
  ),
  
  .name_repair = "minimal"
  
)

```
